Expected that clicking on the icon is the same as clicking on the page title.

fields.description:
Update the pages about labels in the Confluence User Guide:
* One categorisation: global andpersonal.
* Another categorisation: page, space and team.

Explain how each type of label is used.
Explain how to add/edit/remove each type of label.
fields.summary: User Guide: labels
in the DOC space, find any references to the CONF20 space and update them to point to DOC (since the User Guide is now in the DOC space)

fields.description:
Duplicate entries are occurring in some lists of links e.g. FAQ, related topics, etc.

Cause: we have recently archived the Confluence documentation to space CONF25, and copied the User Guide from CONF20 to DOC. This means that, potentially, a single label can exist in two or even three spaces.

Fix: Confine the contentbylabel macro to a single space, by adding parameter "key=@self".

To find the culprits, do a search for "contentbylabel NOT key=@self" in the DOC space.
fields.summary: Confine contentbylabel macros to current space in Confluence docs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8749].
  {panel}

We have discovered that Confluence is severely impacted by the Google Search Appliance, as seen in CSP-8619. 
* Since each page is dynamic there is no cache setting, so the GSA will hit the same page multiple times a day. In some instances we've had pages re-indexed several times an hour!
* GSA, like Google, is pretty aggressive in following every single link. It hits page source, history, comment focus, everything.
* Our site has ~8000 "current versions" of pages. GSA has indexed up to 65k worth of pages!
* We're using an aggressive robots.txt file (below) but have not yet determined how successful it is.
** The ideal solution would have been to block EVERYTHING but \display\, but we have quite a few pages that use unallowable characters in the page name (and thus URL), such as ?, that doing so would knock out a significant chunk of content.

Suggestions:
* Set up something in the admin console for search engine configuration, something like maybe a check list of what pages should be crawled and what should not. The ones that should not should either use noindex and nofollow meta-tags or maybe *Confluence should generate a custom robots.txt file on its own and place in the root directory*. Either is fine.
* There's no reason for historical pages (version history) to not have cache headers. Set them to never expire as they'll never change.
* All links to edit pages, admin pages, add comment, etc etc should have no-follow meta-tags.
* At the least, it would be ideal if ALL current version pages had the /display/ in the beginning, including the ones with non-standard characters, and EVERYTHING else under different stem. 
** It's almost like this today, just the notable exception that the non-standard titled pages show up under the /viewpage stem instead of display. My robots.txt file below tries to work around that but, unfortunately, there's no way to pick up those pages without also picking up all of the version history pages. Some might want those crawled as well; I suspect most would not.

Thank you.

Peter

Our "aggressive" robots.txt file, again for which we're waiting to see if GSA picks it up like we'd like:
{code}
# Note: this files uses parameters specific to Google, parameters that are not in robots.txt standard
# http://www.google.com/support/webmasters/, http://www.robotstxt.org/wc/faq.html and http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robots_Exclusion_Standard were used to research said parameters
# some links shouldn't show to an anonymous browser such as GAS but are included for completeness

User-agent: * # match all bots. GSA is our primarly crawler but logs indicate there may be others on our Intranet
Crawl-delay: 5 # per http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robots.txt#Nonstandard_extensions, sets number of seconds to wait between requests to 5 seconds. may not work
Disallow: /pages/ # this line to purge GSA of all old page entries, will be removed in next iteration so that specific /pages/ lines below take effect
# DISABLED FOR NOW Visit-time: 0600-0845 # per http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robots.txt#Extended_Standard, only visit between 6:00 AM and 8:45 AM UT (GMT), may not work
Disallow: /admin/ # administrator links
Disallow: /adminstrators.action? # remove any administrator links
Disallow: /createrssfeed.action? # remove internal RSS links
Disallow: /dashboard.action? # remove the dashboard, heavy resource hit
Allow: /display # ensure primary display pages are allowed
Disallow: /display/*&tasklist.complete= # remove tasklist links
Disallow: /display/*?decorator=printable # remove printable version links
Disallow: /display/*?focusedCommentId= # remove page comment focus links
Disallow: /display/*?refresh= # prevent crawler from clicking refresh button
Disallow: /display/*?replyToComment= # remove reply to comment links
Disallow: /display/*?rootCommentId= # remove news comment focus links
Disallow: /display/*?showComments=true&showCommentArea=true#addcomment # remove add comment links
Disallow: /doexportpage.action? # remove pdf export links
Disallow: /dopeopledirectorysearch.action # people search
Disallow: /dosearchsite.action? # remove specific site searches
Disallow: /exportword? # remove word export links
Disallow: /login.action? # remove the login page
# Next line, 26, will be enabled when line after, 27, is removed
# Allow: /pages/viewpage.action?* # allows indexing of pages with invalid titles for html (such as ?'s). Unfortunately currently allows page history to sneak in
Disallow: /pages/ # this line to purge GSA of all old page entries, will be removed in next iteration so that specific /pages/ lines below take effect
Disallow: /pages/copypage.action? # remove copy page links
Disallow: /pages/createblogpost.action? # remove add news links
Disallow: /pages/createpage.action? # remove add page links
Disallow: /pages/diffpages.action? # remove page comparison pages
Disallow: /pages/diffpagesbyversion.action? # remove page comparison links
Disallow: /pages/editblogpost.action? # remove edit news links
Disallow: /pages/editpage.action? # remove edit page links
Disallow: /pages/removepage.action? # remove the remove page links
Disallow: /pages/revertpagebacktoversion.action? # remove reversion links
Disallow: /pages/templates # remove template pages
Disallow: /pages/templates/ # block template indexes
Disallow: /pages/viewchangessincelastlogin.action? # remove page comparison pages
Disallow: /pages/viewpagesrc.action? # remove view page source links
Disallow: /pages/viewpreviouspageversions.action? # remove the link to previous versions
Disallow: /plugins/ # blocks plug-in calls
Disallow: /rpc/ # remove any RPC links
Disallow: /searchsite.action? # remove the wiki search engine pages
Disallow: /spaces/ # remove space action pages
Disallow: /themes/ # theme links
Disallow: /users/ # remove user action pages
Disallow: /x/ # remove tiny link urls

# End file
{code}
fields.summary: Make Confluence more configureable in how it handles web crawlers such as the Google Search Appliance

fields.description:
At the moment, threaded comments are not enabled by default, yet they're one of the neatest features in Confluence.

We should enable them by default for new installations.
fields.summary: Make threaded comments the default for new installations

fields.description:
Hello,

I found some information about single signon at http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1834 and more information at http://opensource.atlassian.com/seraph/sso.html

We are currently at 2.1.4, is single signon supported for this version? There was lots of tar file available for download, could you please give me some advice on the tar file that can downloaded to accomplish single signon.

Please let me know at the earliest.

Thanks
Yamini
fields.summary: Single Signon

fields.description:
A recent support case brought this problem to light:

{quote}
??We followed the instructions & I think the way Confluence installed itself needs major work, it writes itself into the temp unpack directory, that makes no sense to me.??

??I put the files in??
??/usr/src/confluence-2.2.9/??
??and now??
??/usr/src/confluence-2.5.3/??

??regular unix source directory.??

??Confluence then unpacked itself to /usr/src/confluence-2.2.9/confluence when it should have installed itself in another directory outside of /usr/src/ like any other unix program does, ie /usr/local/confluence-2.5.3 or alike.??
{quote}

Perhaps this should be looked into.

fields.description:
Confluence cannot resolve the file path of the 'temp' directory in the home folder properly if it is modified in the confluence.cfg.xml.
This leads to a 403 - Forbidden - page in Confluence when attempting a PDF Export.

E.g. Default value:
<property name="webwork.multipart.saveDir">${confluenceHome}/temp</property>

Changed value:
<property name="webwork.multipart.saveDir">/home/foo/confluence-temp/test</property>

The result is this URL and 403 page shown:
{noformat}
http://localhost:8080/download//home/foo/confluence-temp/test/export_06192007_133711/ds-32787-20070619-13_37_11.pdf
{noformat}

Checking the proper path with HttpLiveHeaders, the correct path should be something like this:
{noformat}http://localhost:8080/download/temp/export_06192007_133711/ds-32787-20070619-13_37_11.pdf{noformat}

Confluence should be able to update the path with this change. Consequently, it can be fixed by reverting the above _webwork.multipart.saveDir_ back to ${confluenceHome}/temp.

This issue can be reproduced by using the symbolic link as well. 

*Workaround solution:*
On Linux, you can use the file system bind via "fstab" to bind the temp folder with another temp folder from another file system.
fields.summary: PDF, Word and XML exports fail with absolute temp directory path in confluence.cfg.xml
Use IDs for attachment URLs

fields.description:
We recently had the requirement to generate reports of user activity and usage on our Wiki.  Specifically, they wanted to know who has been using Confluence, who last logged in, who never logged in, etc.

According to my research, and your tech support, these kind of reports are not possible.

We would like to request that User events, such as login, logout, page edits, etc, be captured inside the database.  Audit reports can then be run to see who is using the system, and who isn't.
fields.summary: User Event Logging and Reporting

fields.description:
It would let [Firefox|http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Creating_OpenSearch_plugins_for_Firefox] and [IE7|http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms532996.aspx] autodiscover Confluence as a search engine.

That is, navigating to a Confluence 2.10 and above instance should now present users the opportunity to add that site onto their list of search engines. They can now search that confluence site from the convenience of their browser search box anytime.

This feature does not include presenting Confluence search results in XML or in a format consumable by OpenSearch aggregators/syndicaters. 

A corresponding feature request for JIRA is in JRA-12309.
fields.summary: Allow ability to search any Confluence instance from the search box in firefox and IE 7

fields.description:
When editing a wiki page, and clicking on the Insert/Edit image icon to bring up the image properties dialogue, sometimes when I upload images the images resolve to black boxes. And once the image is up there, if I try and use it, it comes up as a broken image link.

I'm loading a JPG, just like all the other graphics I have ever uploaded.  The jpg parser appears to not be able to handle jpgs encoded in the CMYK colorspace.  When I changed the colorspace from CMYK to RGB, the image loads successfully.

I'm guessing this issue isn't on the browser and that each image is actually parsed in order to create thumb views etc....
fields.summary: JPEG image render doesnt support CMYK - black boxes after Jimage upload

fields.description:
At the moment, there are multiple conflicting bits of information about how to build a plugin for Confluence. This needs to be consolidated into a single easy-to-follow guide.

Documentation that is current and maintained:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Creating+a+new+plugin

Documentation that is out of date:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Plugin+Development+Kit ([deprecated source|http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/atlassian/confluence/confluence-development-kit/])

Documentation for user-supplied archetype that now duplicates functionality in our own:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Atlassian+Plugin+Archetype
fields.summary: Plugin documentation needs to be improved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8714].
  {panel}

At present attachment links are a little inconsistent within Confluence

* Linking to an attachment with a wiki link downloads the attachment (or displays it inline depending on the attachment)
* Attachment links in the recently updated list takes you to the attachment hyperlink on the attachments list of the page.

Perhaps all attachment hyperlinks should go via an intermediary metadata page with a preview of the attachment (e.g. a scaled version of an image) plus any relevent metadata such as creation dates, dimensions, pages etc.

This would make a useful extension point for plugins as well. For example an EXIF extractor could display any EXIF data from a photograph on this page.

We could then uncheck all the pages and then check the parents of the areas we wish to export followed by Check Children.

Alternatively a way to save common selections as a template would help.

fields.description:
Currently editing attachments requires that the user download an attachment, edit it, and re-upload it.

Products such as IBM's Quickplace, for example, allow the user to edit the attachment inline. Basically, that would:
1. Lock the attachment
2. Allow the user to launch the attachment (Word, Excel, Visio, etc.)
3. Edit the content in the respective tool
4. Save and close the attachment and return to the Wiki
5. Version the attachment after the Edit
6. Release the attachment

This will help a lot with complex spreadsheets which cannot be handled with wiki tables or large Word docs which cannot be posted as Wiki pages.
fields.summary: Inline Editing of Attachments

Currently you can only attach locally stored images or files whilst in the _edit mode_ of an _existing_ page, but not during the initial page creation process. 

This really slows down the page creation and information capture process which goes against the heart of what a wiki is (given the wiki application name was derived from the Hawaiian word for quick).

fields.description:
This applies to the Image-popup which apparently only gets triggered from the wysiwyg-editor. (could not reproduce anywhere else)

I was wondering why attaching images was failing, however it turns out we just have some rather poorly designed UI. 

When you go to add an image to an existing page, the course of action that I attempted (wanted) was to:

1. Browse and select an image to attach
2. Click ok
3. See my image attached to the page

Instead, the attach file / browse operation is presented in the middle of the screen. If I click on this and click ok, I am presented with an alert that I need to enter a filename (which also means we have two fields on the one screen referring to filenames (one remote and one local) which could be deemed as confusing and not friendly for business users). This in itself is slightly annoying and should be improved by resolving CONF-6597.

But the absolute _worst_ thing is that, if you then click OK, it closes the window and displays a broken image icon in the rich text editor.

The problem, is due to the fact that there is another button called "Attach", which must be clicked, before clicking "OK".

Also, the Attach File 'Browse' operation should be at the top of the screen, given that this is what you are actually trying to do. You want to work out which file to attach and then just attach it so no doubt this should be prioritised to the top of the screen.
fields.summary: Image-attachment popup very user-unfriendly: Attaching image to page fails if user clicks "OK" rather than "Attach"

fields.description:
Using Rich Text Mode removes special characters and the text between them. For instance, if you try to edit a page in Rich Text Mode that has something like this: <BYEBYE>, it will remove it entirely.  This is an issue even if you stay in Rich Text Mode the entire time. In other words, the problem is not caused by switching back and forth between Rich Text Mode and Wiki Markup mode. It occurs if you ever enter Rich Text Mode.

This has happened several times now, where someone edited a single line, and found that the entire page was modified by Rich Text Mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8689].
  {panel}

The need for one plugin to use data from another has become more evident as more new plugins are created.

The major frustration is that one plugin that does most of what I need to do, and could do the whole job if it had one little piece of information from another one, nevertheless can't be used because it can't get that information without the other plugin knowing about it.  Many times there are macros that will return the values needed, but they can't be invoked in the argument list of another macro.  I'm continually amazed that as new tools come into use they seem to forget lessons learned long ago (Doug McIlroy invented the pipe for Unix nearly forty years ago!).

The Reporting and Scaffolding plugins both have {{Suppliers}}, which appear to be the kind of mechanism that is needed.  {{\{report-info\}}} can be used, for example, outside of a report, when using {{Suppliers}} that don't depend on a report context, and some Scaffolding macros likewise don't require a particular macro environment.

The latest problem I have had with this is the Checklists plugin, which offers me no option to select content except by a label or a parent document.  It happens that I want to be able to select pages anywhere in the wiki by other criteria, mostly by metadata values (or their absence), which once again brings up a favorite topic of mine, which is that metadata should be anything - document attributes, labels, etc.

So a proposal might be:

Make a macro, say {{\{metadata-select\}}}, that would return a list of items, of types specified by its parameters, matching metadata values listed in its body, that could be invoked in the argument list of any other macro.

This would increase the flexibility of nearly all plugins, not to mention eliminating a lot of the revision of existing plugins to accommodate others.
fields.summary: Pipe or Other Shared-Data Facility for Plugins
XML Namespaces for Metadata tags

fields.description:
I've seen at least one case where a customer has experienced user logins, and therefore automatic user creation, while the system is undergoing its initial site import.  This of course interferes with loading the import, causing unique key constraint violations when the imported user id clashes with those created by the logins.

I would think that all users should be barred from logging in via any method, including SSO, while a site import is taking place, since anything they do during the import may be destroyed anyway.  This is certainly the case for initial imports.  I can imagine that during a restore from backup after a minor data corruption there *may* be cause to allow users to view pages.
fields.summary: Disable users from logging in during site import (site restore)

fields.description:
Combining the standalone installation guide into one page has benefits for maintainability, but it's pretty tricky when you need to add instructions which are specific to a particular OS.

Specifically, I'd like to see the following changes for the Mac:

- screenshot of installation: extracting the ZIP and copying it to a sensible location
- instructions for how to run startup.sh after opening a Terminal window, rather than double-clicking on it
- Mac-specific instructions for setting the home directory in confluence-init.properties
- links to Mac-related guides, like making Confluence start up automatically on the server or setting JAVA_HOME in your profile.

At the moment, we have various sentences like "If you're running Windows do X", and "If you're on a Mac do Y". These could be eliminated, and all the documents would be much shorter.

The stages breakdown we apply to Windows also isn't appropriate to the Mac. For example, we skip the first stage on a Mac. I think some of the initial steps are easier and can be merged together, whereas the final stage of starting the application from a Terminal is actually the most complex step.
fields.summary: Separate standalone installation guide for each operating system

fields.description:
Problem:
Authentication for requests performed by the remote API do not go through Seraph, so they can't take advantage of Seraph authenticators. XML-RPC and SOAP authentication requests are checked directly against the user-management framework, and tokens are assigned directly by the remote API subsystem. [src: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Understanding+User+Management+in+Confluence ]


The answer of the support is:

If you really need Seraph to be the authenticator, you can either:

- Modify Confluence source code - You'll need to look into the ConfluenceSoapServiceDelegator 
- Write a RPC plug-in which extends (and overrides) the functionalities of the class mentioned above 
Perhaps you would like share your concern and raise a feature request at our issue tracker.


Any help for doing this?
fields.summary: Use Seraph for RPC/SOAP authentication

fields.description:
Our company (small software developer company) is using confluence for documentation purposes. We describe processes, ideas, designs, tool usage etc. All team members are producer and consumer of pages. The author of a page is responsible for the correctness and actuality of the informations on the page.

As usual, the problem is the data quality. Since all authors are responsible themselves to verify and update their pages, and these authors typically have other and probably more important responsibilities, we have a lot of information garbage in our confluence.

In order to improve the data quality, it would be a big help, if a consumer of a page could indicate, if the information on the specific page is very interesting for him but unusable as it is obviously not up to date.

I therefore suggest that similar to the "add comment" link at the bottom of a page, you would add a "please update this page" link / button / whatever. 
Pressing the button should inform the author of the page (e.g. via email) that his page is of interest but likely needs some update. The author can then decide what to do next (create new page from scratch, update page, delete page etc).
fields.summary: Add link "Please update this page" to bottom of pages created in confluence

ldap query filters noted on this page:
filter="(&(objectClass=brownGroup)(objectClass=brownGroup))" attrs="brownGroupRDN
filter="(&(objectClass=brownGroup)(objectClass=brownGroup))" attrs="brownGroupRDN

fields.description:
Use Case: Add Page : Restrictions : Choose Users
Issue:  UUIDs display instead of username (reported in CONF-8662)
Impact: Exposure of group membership to end users violates our information security policy. This is a show stopper. Confluence will not be used in production at Brown University if this issue is not corrected.
Analysis:
Although it may be convenient in some organizations to be able to select individuals from a group membership list, this violates our information security policy.  We need the ability to disable the Group Membership option on the User Search form when restricting access to a wiki page. 

There is a separate issue on this screen that is described in CONF-8662, that prevents the display of members' username, full name, and email address. While this doesn't matter to us if we can disable this form, it should be corrected for the sake of users who want to use this feature, but don't  use an AD-type DN format.
fields.summary: Need the ability to disable the choose users from group membership form (via config file?)

fields.description:
Use Case: Administration : Manage Groups : View Members of Group : Browse Pagination
Issue:  UUIDs display instead of username
Impact: Display of UUIDs in the Confluence UI is a bug that will prevent us from launching Confluence into production.
Analysis:
Review of the LDAP logs reveals the cause of this bug to be an assumption within the Confluence code that the logged in username can be parsed out of the DN.  After retrieving all groups, then retrieving the DNs of all members of a selected group, Confluence then assumes that the value of the first component of the DN is equal to the username attribute defined in the atlassian-user.xml file. While this may be how AD tends to form DNs, it is not how every institution forms DNs in their LDAP servers. Furtermore, to parse information out of a DN is a fundamental violation of LDAP best practices; a DN is an opaque identifier that is not to be parsed. This is probably an attempt to avoid additional LDAP queries to display the names, uids, & email addresses of users, but that is the right way to populate the page as designed.

filter="(&(objectClass=brownGroup)(objectClass=brownGroup))" attrs="brownGroupRDN"
filter="(&(objectClass=brownGroup)(&(brownGroupRDN=COMMUNITY:ALL)(objectClass=brownGroup)))" attrs="hasMember"
filter="(&(objectClass=inetorgperson)(uid=56816df7-3d63-04f9-091a-7a931d7ca2f0))" attrs="uid givenName sn mail"

uids are formed as you would expect: "jcramton". Our DN contains a UUID, in the format "brownUUID=56816df7-3d63-04f9-091a-7a931d7ca2f0,ou=People,dc=brown,dc=edu"

Suggested solutions:
- A preferred solution is to not permit display of LDAP group membership. Try separating LDAP group management from local group management in the administrative interface, so we can disable management of LDAP groups from a config file setting

- Query LDAP for the uid, name, and email attributes for each group member identified by the 2nd filter shown above; that is the proper way to return this data. I understand that the current implementation is a shortcut to save excessive queries against LDAP, but it means you only support DNs formed a particular way.

- Consider the use case of thousands of group members. Many of Brown's groups have 18,000 members. We have no need to review group membership from Confluence, even in the admin interface. When group membership is presented to the end user, it is in fact a violation of our information security policy.
fields.summary: LDAP group membership lists parse DN and assume login username is in DN
Have a common set of labels available to *all* spaces within a Confluence instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8660].
  {panel}

Been using Confluence for a while now and there too many macros to memorize, esp. for a casual user....

When creating a page, there is tiny proportion of macros displayed on the help tab on the right- It doesn't even contain the inserting of an image format.

You can bring up the help, but I tend to just select the *all* tab and do search on that page.

I think a nice solution would be an Ajax searcher that replaces the current help tab on the right.  It starts off with a text box on the top and defaults to the current displayed items.  As you type, through the magic of Ajax, the contents changes to give you results based on what you type.
fields.summary: Ajax markup help search

fields.description:
If you perform a search using a single term in a search box, the actual search issued will be for the term with the final character removed.

For instance, create the following:
a page containing "orange apple pear"
a second page containing "orang appl pea"

Now if you search for "orange" both pages will be returned. Only the first one should have been.
fields.summary: Terms ending in 'e' entered in search box are truncated by one character

fields.description:
original title: ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator doesn't open connection to add membership

(Matt R here)

A user running with the ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator gets the following exceptions when a user needs have group membership added when they log in.

I suspect this is because a database connection isn't open when the SecurityFilter calls the authenticator (it's prior to the filter which opens the session normally, I think). The authenticator needs to use a HibernateTemplate to get a database session before making its changes.

It works in firefox though.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor broken with IE6 and French language pack

fields.description:
As a UI design consulting company, we typically email screen shots to each other and comment on them. Snag IT is a common tool we use. Take a screen shot, paste it into your email message and then comment on it. We commonly have multiple images per message.

JIRA has the attach screen shot link that would be nice to see inside confluences editing tool. You click that link in the toolbar, the new window appears where you paste from the clipboard and ass the meta data, when you save, you see the image appear inside your editing window.

For all the reasons the development and QA community wanted to have a paste screenshot inside JIRA, the design and requirements community will want something like this inside a wiki. 

I find the image image toolbar button to be overloaded. It would be nice to has one for adding an image and another for editing an existing image... but I kept the existing constraints as I worked this into my sugestion.
fields.summary: JIRA allows you to paste in screen shots while editing. Confluence can benefit from this as well

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8655].
  {panel}

Hi,

I have some colleagues who are to be new users of Confluence, and wikis in general. They are not technical staff, but are used to email, office apps, etc. What I'd really like is a short (10 - 15 minute) single tutorial document that can be given to such users to walk them through what Confluence is about, and how they can get started.

The user guide in the documentation site really isn't basic enough.

This relates to support request CSP-9370
fields.summary: Tutorial documentation for non-technical users
CLONE -Page titles with a period '.' breaks daily backup
blog-posts macro should have an option to generate an RSS feed of the aggregated items

fields.description:
When you insert a horizontal line (something like <hr>) using the WYSIWYG editor, and then right behind it an emoticon, the horizontal rule is not displayed correctly. Instead, the four hyphens and the emoticon are shown on one line. See attachments.

How to reproduce:
- insert a horizontal line
- immediately after that insert an emoticon
- save the page
- resulting code is displayed incorrectly.
fields.summary: Rich-text editor removes newline following horizontal rule, turning it into four dashes

fields.description:
Using the line indenting button of the WYSIWYG editor does not work for standard paragraphs.
The editor obviousely does something: The line is (a bit), and for each indenting level, one vertical blue bar is displayed next to the line.

However, if you save the text, not only are the lines not indented, but they are also concatenated.

How to reproduce:
- create a new document
- enter three lines ("1", "2" and "3")
- for each line, move the cursor to that line and press the indent buttton
- save the page
- the text is now displayed as  "123"
fields.summary: line indenting does not work

fields.description:
When you insert an image and then insert a character right behind that image (not on the next line!), the page is not saved correctly:
Instead of displaying the image and the text, the code necessary to generate that image is shown on the resulting page.

How to reproduce:
- create a new page
- add an image attachment to that page
- edit the page and insert the image
- click with the mouse behind that image. The cursor must be positioned behind the image, not on the next line. Now insert any character
  (see attachment)
- save the document
- the resulting page shows the code (!image!) instead of the image. See attachment
fields.summary: code shown instead of image

fields.description:
When creating a table and then pressing enter within that table, the size of the row is changed. However, if you delete that empyt line again, the size of the table is not properly adjusted.

How to reproduce:
- create a  new document
- add a table (eg. 2x2 with heading)
- insert some text in each cell
- press enter in any cell of the table
- press backspace to delete the newly created line

Note that the table is now displayed with incorrect row height (but if you save it and reopen it,everything looks ok).

See attachment.
fields.summary: wrong display of tables after pressing enter
